title: Who are the most famous Urdu novelists? - Quora

response.answer_text: Thanks for A2A Fawad Lang.Urdu literature is a vast field with many big names. Some of the most famous novelists are:Maulana Muhammad Hussain Azad: famously known for his novel Aab-e-Hayat. Munshi Premchand: Famous for Bazaar-e-Husn and Shatranj k Khiladi. Although, I liked his work from our 10th-grade lesson “Guli Danda”. Deputy Nazeer Ahmed: The first novelist in Urdu literature. His all-time famous novel is Taubat-un-Nasuh. Mirat-ul-Uroos is his another literary work, also known to be first Urdu novel. Mirza Hadi Ruswa: Umrao Jaan Ada is his most famed novel. There are Pakistani and Indian films based on this famous novel. Naseem Hijazi: Muhammad Bin Qasim, Qaisar-o Kisra and Andheri Raat Ke Musafir are his prominent writings. Razia Butt: Her well-known novel Bano is dramatized as Dastaan by Hum TV. Shaukat Siddique: All of us are aware of the very famous Khuda ki Basti and Kemyaghar. Ibn-e-Insha: The famous travelogue. Chaltay ho tho Cheen ko Chaliyey, Ibn-e-Batuta k Ta’aqub main and Dunya Gol hai are his prominent travelogues. Bano Qudsia: Raja Gidh, the modern classic, is her most famed novel. Among her other prominent writings are Hasil Ghaat, Aatish-e-Zer-e-pa and Hawa k Naam. Mumtaz Mufti: Ali Pur ki Aali, Alakh Nagri and Labaik are among his famous writngs. Mustansar Hussain Tarar: His most famed writings include Niklay Teri Talash main, Andulus Main Ajnabi and Pyar Ka Pehla Shehr. Umera Ahmad: The modern-day Urdu novelist is famous among the youth of today. She has on her credit, the famous Peer-e-Kamil, Man-o-Salwa, and Aks. Fatima Surayya Bajia: Agahi, Tareekh-o-Tamseel and Tasweer-e-Kainat are among her famous writings. Farhat Ishtiaq: Although not the most famous but a modern day famous Urdu novelist, Famous for writing romantic fiction. Among her best writings are Humsafar, Mata-e-Jaan Hai Tu, and Jo Bachay hai Sang Samait lo.
